Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: TaherAlbaghliJulian
Reviews.Content: The location excellent near lake , super market , resturants,shops and college. i came her to visit my cousin who study in Uni. i like this hotel becuase good price , free parking, Air conditioning, free wifi. clean room but not luxury. dico for dance . quiet, and wonder ful viewing.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth even the $57 that I paid”
Reviews.Author: Lisa M
Reviews.Content: I traveled April 2011 with my daughter to visit an area college and was afraid in the room, in the elevator, in the lobby and especially in the rear parking lot. This hotel was in such disrepair that it is incredible that they are allowed to stay open. We were kept up most of the night by arguing drunk people in the next room. The AC was inadequate and unable to be adjusted cooler or warmer, the elevator made so much noise we feared it would break down. The parking lot was so broken down that you bottomed out entering and exiting. I was looking for a basic place to lay our heads as we came in late and were leaving early, and didn't even get that. We wondered how clean the linens were based on the rest of the surroundings. I would NEVER recommend this place to anyone and especially anyone with a family. We did not feel safe at all. The one saving grace to this hotel is the gentleman behind the counter was incredibly nice and accommodating. He is the ONLY reason we got past the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Just not very nice”
Reviews.Author: crazyoldbat
Reviews.Content: The rooms were clean enough & what few staff we met were friendly & helpful. But we got the impression that they were extremely over-worked & the very nice man in charge of the lobby didn't even have time off to eat or a place to eat in - he had a folding table & ate hastily in a corner of the lobby, continuing to serve customers whilst he tried to get a meal in - he was still working 10 (?) hours later & was still the only one in the lobby.* The room looked good from a housekeeping point of view but it lacked supplies - no bath mat & very limited towels. Half the drawers in the place were fake & there were no facilities in the room for making anything, not even a cup of tea. Nor was there any such in the lounge or lobby - nor was there a breakfast room - no breakfast of any description, not even an urn of hot water for tea or coffee at any time. We were told we could go to the gas station next door for a cup of coffee (we wanted just hot water for tea) We had been warned by previous reviews that parking was very limited & had even read the hotel's response that their parking issues were resolved. They were not - we were directed to park in front of the restaurant next door & we saw later that others were double-parked on the hotel's forecourt. I do not know how those behind could get out if the ones parked on the outside didn't move first. They said the hotel's car park was "under repairs" but, in that case that's been so for many months, & it is a good-sized hotel so, very inadequate space. The housekeeping staff were not noisy but the walls were so thin you could not help hearing the noises they made whilst cleaning. It was not their fault! The place was very noisy & someone started drilling first thing the morning of our departure. In the lobby at night, there were several people hanging around &, judging by their dress & behaviour, they were prostitutes & either their johns or their pimps (& one small boy amusing himself hopping up & down around the lobby floor, poor child) We overheard one man trying to rent a room for an hour. Credit to the hotel - he was made to pay for the whole night. There was also a very competent-looking & pleasant security guard there* who kept an eye on everyone so I could be wrong about the people - but I would not recommend this hotel to anyone with a family - I'm not sure I would recommend it to anyone! But please note the staff were very pleasant, helpful & likeable people - I just have my doubts about the owners of this place!

Reviews.Title: “hooker heaven”
Reviews.Author: casko4
Reviews.Content: entered parking lot and there were hookers coming and going. The parking was very limited and mostly on the street. I was still in my car watching the people go by and someone actually tried my door handle to get in. The car next to me was being broken into. I went into the lobby to cancel my reservation and there was a man wanting his money back because his hotel door would not lock .

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Judy_C_1975
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had plans to go to a wedding in the city so I made a reservation for 1 night. First of all, there was no place to park. After we checked in and got to our room it was filthy, the air conditioning and the tv weren't working. This was unacceptable so we left to stay somewhere else. We found a nicer hotel to stay in and while we were getting ready to go to the wedding I realized that we left the gift in the crappy hotel room. I called the front desk and they said they'd hold it there for me. Well I went in the following morning and no one seemed to know anything about it. So not only is this hotel in terrible condition but the customer service is terrible too. Don't stay here!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: havefunwill
Reviews.Content: Clean large room, great friendly desk and hotel staff, great shower water flow, nice cool a/c and comfy beds AND across the street from Saks Fifth Avenue, shopping and Chili's Restaurant bus stop to center city at the door...and if you don't want to cross the street a pizza shop next door--location..location..location and a parking lot that is extremely well-lit at a great price--we will definately be back. Thanks NAMI you guys rock!-

Reviews.Title: “Alright For The Price”
Reviews.Author: Day_tripper1234
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend stayed here in june 2011 on a budget, the area is great! a few restaurants and a small outdoor shopping centre, the hotel was abit of a let down though. The front desk staff weren't very friendly when we arrived and didnt seem interested at all. Arriving in our room they advertised free high speed internet, which it has WHEN YOU CAN GET A SIGNAL which is barely ever! and when you do it constantly disconnects. Its a conference center and a function room so it got quite noisy on a couple of nights due to downstairs wedding parties etc. The room was tidy and the beds were comfy, the only problem we saw was that the shower curtain had black mould on it and the bath was grubby! there are a few bus stops outside to easily get to downtown philadelphia and fairmount park which is great! if your looking for a cheap place to stay its ok but i wouldnt stay here again

Reviews.Title: “NYC Birthday Trip”
Reviews.Author: pokeyfeet
Reviews.Content: This had to be one of the worst places to stay that I have ever experienced. The staff was kind of friendly but the place is in poor condition. The elevator is very noisy and one of our party did get stuck. The carpets were filthy. There were no "Do Not Disturb" cards to insert after they were requested. The place was loud and the parking was atrocious. We were told there were 16 spaces for 90 rooms. The beds were passable. There were not enough towels and no shampoo. The ice machine was on the first floor which is difficult considering the condition of the elevators. Enough said, go else where if possible.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible dump”
Reviews.Author: mbhallll
Reviews.Content: Sign by the cashier offers $20 for "top review" on Trip Advisor, Yahoo.com and $10 more on Expedia. Smoke detector was hanging by one wire in one room. Both AC wall units are in improvised boxes with on-off switch, no thermostat. A leak in the ceiling outside poured water on my car. The garage is falling down, should be condemned. Exit ramp blocked by tipped over saw horses and yellow police tape. I called Expedia and canceled, demanded my money back. I was scared to even put a bag in the room. Michael H.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid At All Costs”
Reviews.Author: Kokopelli2011
Reviews.Content: You should be very supect of any positive review you read for this hotel. At the front desk is a sign letting customers know that they can receive $20 cash for writing a positive review for the hotel. They are buying good ratings. I've traveled the world and have stayed at hotels in some of the worst third world countries you can imagine. This is absolutely the worst hotel experience I've ever had. I booked a room for me and my family for two nights but only stayed for one. The room was dirty, smelled bad and was noisy. People were running up and down the hall all night making noise. I stayed on the 4th floor but could here the music booming from the club until well past 2 AM. When I told the person at the front desk that I was leaving and the reasons why, he wasn't surprised and didn't care. I asked politely for some money back but they flat out refused. I could go on and on but I think you get the point. If you're wondering, "could it really be that bad?", take a chance and see for yourself.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel of great value”
Reviews.Author: Savytraveler1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great value. Although the price is low, the rooms are spacious, cozy, and clean. The staff at the front is very nice, warm, professional, and always willing to help. We got there on a Sunday, we actually saw church services in the first floor of the motel. While the hotel itself has no restaurant, there are many restaurants near the hotel, including a Subway 50 yards away and Olive Garden on the otherwise of the road. A grocery store and Lord &Taylor are also located on the other side of the road.

Reviews.Title: “The management was absolutely the best”
Reviews.Author: zalina1
Reviews.Content: The staff was extremely helpful,We couldn't ask for more. Great location- close to the convention center and all convenience.

Reviews.Title: “A WASTE OF MONEY”
Reviews.Author: PA2VA2CT
Reviews.Content: The location was perfect. The customer service was good, the people were very nice. Parking is horrible. If they have an event at the hotel while your staying, you can forget about convenient parking. Elevator had duck tape on the door and seemed like it was ready to break down every time in use. The room was cleaned alright, but did not look like anyone has stayed there in years. I seen roaches soon as I walked in. Can not adjust heat settings. Bathroom needs serious renovations, cracks and rust on the tub. Room is not provided with an iron or ironing board which was very inconvenient. I was in the area for a party so soon after the party I decided against staying because I was so uncomfortable and I checked out.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Miss The Booking Chance in this HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: SAMIK1985ARMY
Reviews.Content: First of all what can i say about this FABULUS HOTEL, i can summarize my review in the following tips: - Clean & warm rooms. - Hotel good service. - Hotel good facilities. - Hotel workers are nice and hospitable. - The hotel has a great location every thing it can be found her (resturants, markets, malls, banks, most of the educational insititutes)

Reviews.Title: “Good Management = A Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: appleseeds101
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the North American Motor Inn and I had a delightful stay. This hotel is now under new management so there have been so pleasant changes over the new year. The quality of staff has been upgraded and now all the rooms have wifi and basic cable in them. This hotel is relatively quiet and quaint and the rates are extremely affordable. Under it's new management and outstanding customer service, I would recommend this hotel to anyone who is on a budget and is visiting Philly from out of town.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff and helpful”
Reviews.Author: Gato911
Reviews.Content: High speed internet Room is clean Nice view from the 4th floor - view of downtown Philly Help staff from parking assistants to the maintainence person

Reviews.Title: “Bad Hotel Experince”
Reviews.Author: Kilandra926
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel only for the reason that it fit in the budget with a flight and there was no heat for when it was freezing, the blankets did not help with the cold weather, i stayed on the 4th floor and while it was raining, the rain was leaking through the ceiling, there was no fridge, no heater, no shampoo, one bar of soap, the tv had limited if any channels, the climate control was just an on/off button for the air conditioning which didnt help when it was cold, there was limited sodas and snacks in the snack machine, the ice machine was on the 1st floor and the drinks were on the 4th floor and there was a chicken bone in the elevator and the elevator doors sound like they are broken. I did not mind the noise that was coming from the banquet room since i was on the 4th floor luckily for me i had my fiance and his friend stay with me and if they could they would also write a review about this place

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare - Scary - Over Priced Motel - Incorrect Expedia.com rating”
Reviews.Author: FactualExperience
Reviews.Content: One Dot rating is more than this motel deserves... After a long day of traveling, when my business colleague and I tried to check in at 11 PM, initially they could not find our reservation, or pre-payment through Expedia.com. We also discovered that this motel has 1 hour rates, two and three-day specials that were less expensive than our supposed Expedia.com discount. There are so many accurate, horrible descriptions of this location. To be clear: this is not 3-4 stars, as Expedia.com insists. They have not personally visited this property. The motel online photos do not correctly depict the location. We were given rooms on the 4th, a non-smoking floor that smelled of cigarette smoke. The room was dated and ill-kept. Of great concern were the vertical blinds that do not meet to ensure privacy and block light. One half of the window blind slats are not the same length. Lights had nonworking, or absent bulbs. The ceiling had water damage. The only place one can get wifi is in the cold lobby. It was a scary experience and total waste of our time. We ended up leaving and checking into a 4-star downtown Philadelphia hotel at 2 AM. For video experience: http://bit.ly/b30gcl Do not trust Expedia.com

Reviews.Title: “NEED DRASTIC IMPROVEMENT”
Reviews.Author: toots1976
Reviews.Content: This facility was booked in 2008 for a 3 night family reunion event. My family arrived on June 24th only to find that some of the rooms were dirty and keys were given to rooms that were already occupied (security Issue). I booked 2 rooms and twice there was a problem. If I was a thief, I could have walked off with a Blackberry and laptop that was left charging in one of the rooms. Some of the rooms were hot, including 2 of the banquet rooms. After the first night when we came back to the hotel from our picnic (after 5pm) my 2 rooms were not cleaned and I was told that because I was given a special rate, the rooms were not cleaned daily, (however they were not cleaned at all during my stay) but I was given clean linen and told that I could change my bed. There were a lot of other negative things going on, but for the most part our family made the best of a bad situation and had a good time. Also some of the staff were pretty nice and I think that Al, the maintenance man was the friendliest and hardest working guy that I came into contact with. I wouldn't recommend this facility at all unless they make some drastic changes.

Reviews.Title: “U get what u pay for...reasonable price for reasonable service.”
Reviews.Author: dwebber224
Reviews.Content: I was in the Philadelphia area on business, and ended up at the NAMI. I admit I'm frugile, so when I heard of the weekly rate I jumped on it. The staff was friendly and helpful. The walls are thin, but the room was fairly clean. New carpets and the spread was clean. There was a mall strip mall across the street, and a gas station next door. There was also a snack and drink machine located on the floor. Don't get me wrong it was not five star...but hey, u get what u pay for.

Reviews.Title: “It was awful”
Reviews.Author: rerake
Reviews.Content: For those who gave a good review, PLEASE. I stayed from Friday to Sunday and Sunday was fine. I live out of town and my daughter wanted to visit friends. My son and I wanted to do some shopping and visit the museums. MY sons car and mine were broken into. He left his wallet accidently in the drawer in the room and the $350 cash I gave him disappeared. Although the the house keeper was very nice and over apologetic we did not get that money back. We were told that we had to speak to the manger who never called me on Monday but I've been calling her. There was very loud parties on Saturday night and we didn't get to sleep until after 3am. surprisingly the cars were robbed Friday night and not Party night. I was assured that no one took money from our room and that house keeping hadn't gotten to our room although the beds were made. They were very charming although I know the money was there. We reserved two rooms and when we got there they said they had no reservation and they were full so we had to wait until 11pm for the one room we did get Friday night. I assume that expedia.com didn't send it but I didn't really think that the hotel had a running computer. I asked the guy at the desk to look for a bertucci's restuarant and he said the system was down. I wondered how do they get online reservations if that happens. over all I'd sleep in my car before there!

Reviews.Title: “Thought I was going to get a disease from the here!!”
Reviews.Author: sailorskuff
Reviews.Content: NEVER GO TO THE NORTH AMERICAN MOTOR INN!!!! I have NEVER been in a place so disgusting. And definitely never payed so much money to do so.. It was ridiculous!!! It was 12:30 am before my husband and I got to our destination.. Thinking we would find a hotel once we got there, was a bad idea.. Every hotel was full. Except the motor inn (wonder why.. Must have been a slow night for the prostitutes!). We should have knows better just by looking at the place. And we got a bad feeling pulling into there unaccommodating parking garage, that seems the size for a doll house. Making sure to to grab anything valuable and important (my husbands lab top, and the cash we brought to buy a new car) we made the trip inside.. Only to find an anything but nice front desk guy.. Everything in the hotel looked like tramps-r-us. Including the mirrored ceiling to floor- wall to wall elevator.. My husband and I were there for not even an hour and we started getting sick. Like a pit in our stomach that we shouldn't be there. Mean-while.. We didn't use anything. We layed a blanket i brought down on top of the bed and layed on that.. Not wanting to use their disgusting blankets, that im sure weren't washed and had been through.. Well, something my husband and I definitely weren't considering. The hookers must have been playing tag in the hall way at 1 in the morning. At least that's what it sounded like. DO NOT GO TO THE NORTH AMERICAN MOTOR INN!!!! We had no idea about them. I feel like i need to go get tested after being there for an hour.. Which by the way they wouldn't refund us. Knowing we didn't use a single thing.. not like they were going to wash or change the sheets anyway, even if we had. You'd think the kind of place they are, they WOULD charge by the hour. Money hungry and comparable to he'll. We left there around 1:30 and drove and drove just to get away from there.. Wound up finding a Hampton Inn for $10 LESS THAN WE PAYED FOR MOTOR INN!! WORST NIGHT OF MY LIFE!!! PLEASE AVOID THE MOTOR INN!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this place”
Reviews.Author: Traveller72Usa
Reviews.Content: Haven for prostitutes. Can hear sexual activity in adjacent room. Rooms were unclean and bombarded with noise from nightclub on first floor.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as I read!”
Reviews.Author: Hazel2290
Reviews.Content: I usually read reviews before I stay at placed but I didn't read for this place. It was very basic however it was fairly clean(as clean as you get for a low price). I didn't have a noise problem. Everything worked but the elevator did get stuck as we were leaving. It would be nice if they had bigger beds. I didn't see any hookers and while it is a more African American area I saw few black people. I didn't really see anyone. I will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here..I repeat do not stay here!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: LEWIDE
Reviews.Content: Very noisy..Very Dirty...For what we paid , It was NOT worth it...No coffee maker..they gave us three bars of very thin soap which broke as soon as you put it on the rag (It was NOt a wash cloth )They had a ice bucket in the room, but no where to get ice. It was too late to go to target to get some clean sheets. They only had one lock on the door..I made my family stay with me..The smell OMG!!!!!!!!!!!! BAD. The carpet on the floor had to be over 10 years old. Dirty Dirty Dirty..Again run.. The STAFF..Very Nice...

Reviews.Title: “Nasty Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PaigeOhio
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the worst hotel experience I ever had. The room was totally dirty. The only thing on the bed was a flat sheet and comforter. It was noisy all night. Our car got broken into and they stole some very valueable things. This hotel should not be in business.

Reviews.Title: “LOOKS ARE NOT DECEIVING SOMETIMES..TURN AROUND AND DONT LOOK BACK!”
Reviews.Author: ladyroller99
Reviews.Content: All I Have to say is dont stay here! I had crumbs in my bed and my bathroom toilet ran constantly. I asked for a refund and have yet to receive it. Please go elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Low budget”
Reviews.Author: Traveler0330
Reviews.Content: I only stayed here because I was going to Philly by myself and wanted to be near the person I was visiting, and didn't want to spend $200 at the Hilton down the street. I called the hotel and was told they had plenty of rooms, but they weren't taking reservations, just to come in. Pretty strange. The hotel is on a very busy street, but it seemed like decent and safe neighborhood, with some shopping and restaurants nearby. I was lucky to get one of the few parking spaces out front when I checked in. When I got to the room, it was very basic but fairly clean. The toilet was running when I got there, I had to jiggle the handle to stop it. No iron, no blow dryer, no alarm clock. No cable either, about 12 local channels. The ac only has an on/off button, can't adjust it. It was fairly loud and didn't keep the room cool on an 80 degree day. Friday night was quiet, but Saturday, there was like 7 parties going on downstairs and I had to park on the street and could hear music till past 3 am. In 3 days, I never saw another white person in the hotel besides myself. None of this bothered me, I just thought it was funny. I wasn't expecting much for $100, and didn't get much. The only thing that made me mad was when I checked out, some fool had blocked my car in, and locked his keys in the car. I had to wait over an hour until he jimmied the door. Staff at the hotel offered no help at all.

Reviews.Title: “Would not go back”
Reviews.Author: tammicpr
Reviews.Content: There was no hot water, toilets did not flush, shower took long to drain. The rooms were barely cleaned: floor not vacummed, tables not wiped, bathroom and other floors not mopped. Some room doors could not lock. Definately a scene for crime....I would not go back.

Reviews.Title: “Crime ring in the making!”
Reviews.Author: fulltiltinthehouse
Reviews.Content: I was at the motel for a 50th birthday party and my roommates car was robbed in the parking garage. They stole some very valuable items. The motel staff basically said "to bad, we are not responsible" I filed a police report and they laughed when I told them where I was at at the time of the robbery. They have multiple problems there on a weekly basis. If you stay at this motel, you are foolish, for I believe the staff is in on the theft ring, so does the police! Why they are able to stay in business is beyond me! Also, at the end of the party, about 10 individuals show up trying to crash the party and the police had to escort them off the premisis. Do not give them your business! They need to be shut down and I will do my best to get it done!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful value”
Reviews.Author: Calgary-woman
Reviews.Content: The hotel was fine and conveniently located for our visit. The service was excellent, the room was clean and quiet and we received excellent value. The towels were quite plush. We stayed on the third floor and did not hear any party noises, even over a weekend. I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “i didnt think it was that bad...”
Reviews.Author: babiieajack
Reviews.Content: i think the north american was fun ..its good for partys..and from the other reviews you can tell its more of a party hotel then comfortable and quite..so for the people who have stayed there do research before you stay some where with such bad reviews..thats your fault..AJ

Reviews.Title: “Horrible, Watch Out For the Local Hookers!!”
Reviews.Author: phillygirlc
Reviews.Content: This is the worse hotel in Philadelphia! The hotel was very noisy, people having their events all over the place, guest roaming through the place and don't forget the local hookers seeking for jons. Also, little known fact, the gas station next door is owned by the hotel too where the hookers are trying to solicit business. The management and staff at this place is unprofessional and disrespectful. Do yourself a favor, don't stay at this joint. RUN!

Reviews.Title: “worst motel I've ever been to”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As all the hotels in the area were full, my father and I decided to make a reservation here. When we arrived, they had no record of our reservation. Parking was a nightmare: they have a very cramped and tortuously twisting parking garage which is not conducive to minivans or SUV's and doesn't contain enough spaces to accomodate all guests. We wound up parking across the street in a shopping mall lot (probably illegally). The motel houses a party center as well, resulting in a very noisy environment and a rowdy clientele. The doors provide very little security, the bedding consisted of only a sheet and bedspread, there were no face towels or shampoo and no housekeeping service. In retrospect, I would have driven up to an hour away to stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “No Title (I've Editorialized Enough in the Review)”
Reviews.Author: booradley2
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this motel for one night and I found it to be very quiet. I'm not disputing what the previous poster said about thin walls and noise----I suspect the place was quiet because there were almost no other guests on the premises when I was there. (I stayed there on a Sunday night, in case you're considering it.) In light of the fact that I spent almost twice as much at the Holiday Inn just down the street on the previous night, and it was noisy, I think this place was a bargain on that score. On the other hand, I didn't think my room was very clean. In fact, it was probably near the lower limit of my standards. (Maybe it was all the cigarette burns in the carpet and furniture that turned me off.) There is one other thing---I'm kind of reluctant to mention it: almost everybody I saw in the motel was black, and I got the feeling my presence was, well, disapproved of. (I happen to be white.) No one did or said anything overt. It was just that, for example, if I greeted someone, they wouldn't reply. Or I noticed people frowning when they looked at me. Subtle signals like that. I'm not saying I felt unsafe or anything, just unwelcome. (Hey, I call 'em the way I see 'em.)

Reviews.Title: “Won't be going back...”
Reviews.Author: filmstarco
Reviews.Content: After learning that all our favorite hotels were sold out in Center City and Old City Philiadelphia, my husband and I ended up the North American Motor Inn. I will say right off the bat that everything was clean but that's where the compliments stop. The walls are paper thin, they don't have the best "clientel" and it's extremely noisy (and the fact that it's above a banquet hall and next to a gas station does not help). Also, the only lock on the room door was a push knob lock. We slept with a chair pushed against the door and hid our valuables while we were out. Happy to report nothing was stolen, but still not a very safe feeling. Unless you are truly stuck with needing a place to stay (like we were) I don't suggest staying here. I'm not a hotel snob, I'm actually pretty easy to please. But even for me...this place was just horrendous.

HotelInfo.Name: North American Motor Inns
HotelInfo.Address: 4444 City Avenue, Philadelphia, PA 19131 (Formerly U.S. One Hotel)
